snippet: With the state’s roads and bridges crumbling and its mass transit plagued with problems, an idea once considered politically unthinkable is gaining traction: increasing the famously low gas tax.
abstract: Leading Democrats in New Jersey propose raising gas tax in order to pay for critical repairs to state's vital infrastructure; Gov Christopher J Christie opposes plan, but some Republicans support it, and Democrats, who control Senate and assembly, hope to have enough votes to override any veto.
lead_paragraph: With the state’s roads and bridges crumbling and its mass transit plagued with problems, an idea once considered politically unthinkable is gaining traction: increasing the famously low gas tax.

headline.main: Higher Gas Tax in New Jersey: After Years of No, It May Be Time for Yes
headline.print_headline: New Jersey May Increase Famously Low Gas Tax
